text: Flory Jagoda (born Flora Papo; December 21, 1923 â€“ January 29, 2021) was a Bosnian Jewish-American guitarist, composer and singer-songwriter. She was known for her interpretation of Ladino songs and the Bosnian folk ballads, sevdalinka. Jagoda died on 29 January 2021 from problems caused by dementia, aged 97. ==References== Category:1923 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Deaths from dementia Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Bosnia and Herzegovina writers Category:American guitarists Category:American composers Category:American singer-songwriters Category:Musicians from Virginia Category:Singers from Virginia Category:Bosnia and Herzegovina entertainers
title: Flory Jagoda
